Loop 1 has 4 curves: 2 lines and 2 arcs. Draw loop 2: - Center at (0.15, 0.15), radius of 0.075. Draw loop 3: - Center at (0.6, 0.15), radius of 0.075. Create a new 3D sketch by transforming the 2D sketch based on the coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0, 0, 0.15). Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.075 units along the positive Z-axis. **Part 2: Cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom, resembling a stylized cone** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with no rotation and a translation vector of (0.525, 0.075, 0.15). Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw loop 1: - Center at (0.075, 0.075), radius of 0.075. The final shape, formed by joining parts 1, 2, and 3, has a flat top and bottom connected by a cylindrical shaft. The shaft has a smaller diameter than the cylinders. The height of the final shape is the sum of the heights of parts 1, 2, and 3; the width and length of the final shape are the same as the width and length of part 1.</description>
